title: Add and simplify radical expressions
hint: To add or subtract radicals, you need the same radicand.
feedback:
Factor the radicands in 
<!-- (your LaTeX) $\sqrt{50} + \sqrt{18}$ -->
<math>
<mrow>
 <msqrt>
  <mn>50</mn>
 </msqrt>
 <mo>+</mo>
 <msqrt>
  <mn>18</mn>
 </msqrt>
</mrow>
</math>
. You get 
<!-- (your LaTeX) $\sqrt{25\cdot2} + \sqrt{9\cdot2}$ -->
<math>
<mrow>
 <msqrt>
  <mrow>
   <mn>25</mn>
   <mo>⋅</mo>
   <mn>2</mn>
  </mrow>
 </msqrt>
 <mo>+</mo>
 <msqrt>
  <mrow>
   <mn>9</mn>
   <mo>⋅</mo>
   <mn>2</mn>
  </mrow>
 </msqrt>
</mrow>
</math>
. Pulling out the perfect squares gives 
<!-- (your LaTeX) $5\sqrt{2} + 3\sqrt{2}$ -->
<math>
<mrow>
 <mn>5</mn>
 <msqrt>
  <mn>2</mn>
 </msqrt>
 <mo>+</mo>
 <mn>3</mn>
 <msqrt>
  <mn>2</mn>
 </msqrt>
</mrow>
</math>
. Because they are like radicals, you can add. The answer is 
<!-- (your LaTeX) $8\sqrt{2}$ -->
<math>
<mrow>
 <mn>8</mn>
 <msqrt>
  <mn>2</mn>
 </msqrt>
</mrow>
</math>
